abstract: French police storm Paris printing plant and kill Cherif and Said Kouachi, brothers who were wanted in massacre at Paris newspaper office Charlie Hebdo; also kill their alleged associate Amedy Coulibaly, who took hostages at kosher supermarket and killed four people before police arrived; terrorists killed at least 17 French citizens during three days of bloodshed.
lead_paragraph: The police killed two brothers who had links to Al Qaeda in Yemen and were suspected in the massacre at a Paris newspaper office. In a nearly simultaneous raid, officers also killed an alleged associate of the brothers who had held hostages in a kosher supermarket.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by David Jolly from Dammartin-en-Goële, France, and Maïa de la Baume, Aurelien Breeden, Nicola Clark and Rukmini Callimachi from Paris.
byline.original: By ANDREW HIGGINS and DAN BILEFSKY

headline.main: French Police Storm Hostage Sites, Killing Gunmen
headline.seo: Charlie Hebdo Suspects Dead in Raid; Hostage Taker in Paris Is Also Killed
headline.sub: Some Hostages Are Freed in 2 Raids; at Least 4 Die
